# FileInput A versatile file input component with drag-and-drop support, file previews, validation, and multiple style variants. ## Basic Usage ## Props Name Type Default Description `name` `string` - The name of the file input field (used for form submission) `description` `string` - Optional description text to display below the label `hint` `string` - Optional hint text to display below the file input `error` `string` - Error message to display (typically from Zod validation) `required` `boolean` `false` Whether the field is required `variant` `'default' | 'pill'` `'default'` File input variant - 'default' or 'pill' `coloredBorder` `boolean` `false` Whether to show a colored border (only applies to pill variant) `multiple` `boolean` `false` Whether to accept multiple files `accept` `string` - Accepted file types (e.g., "image/*", ".pdf", etc.) `maxSize` `number` - Maximum file size in bytes `maxFiles` `number` `5` Maximum number of files (only applies when multiple is true) `showPreviews` `boolean` `true` Whether to show file previews `showIcons` `boolean` `true` Whether to show file type icons
## Examples ### Default Variant ```tsx ``` ### Multiple Files Upload ```tsx ``` ### Pill Variant with Colored Border ```tsx ``` ## Validation The FileInput component supports Zod validation: ```tsx import { z } from "zod"; import { useState } from "react"; import { FileInput } from "@/components/ui/file-input"; export default function FileValidationExample() { const [error, setError] = useState(); // Schema to validate file size const maxSize = 5 * 1024 * 1024; // 5MB const schema = z.instanceof(File).refine( (file) => file.size <= maxSize, { message: "File must be less than 5MB", } ); const handleValidate = (isValid: boolean, file: File, error?: string) => { setError(error); }; return ( ); } ``` ## Accessibility The FileInput component is built with accessibility in mind: - Proper labeling and ARIA attributes - Keyboard navigable interface - Error messages are properly associated with the input - Support for screen readers with appropriate text descriptions - Visual indicators for drag-and-drop states
